description: Infers a schema for a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application by evaluating sample records on the specified streaming source (Kinesis data stream or Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream) or Amazon S3 object. In the response, the operation returns the inferred schema and also the sample records that the operation used to infer the schema. You can use the inferred schema when configuring a streaming source for your application. When you create an application using the Kinesis Data Analytics console, the console uses this operation to infer a schema and show it in the console user interface.

parameters.name: ServiceExecutionRole
parameters.description: The ARN of the role that is used to access the streaming source.

parameters.name: InputStartingPositionConfiguration
parameters.description: The point at which you want Kinesis Data Analytics to start reading records from the specified streaming source for discovery purposes. InputStartingPosition (string) --- The starting position on the stream. NOW - Start reading just after the most recent record in the stream, and start at the request timestamp that the customer issued. TRIM_HORIZON - Start reading at the last untrimmed record in the stream, which is the oldest record available in the stream. This option is not available for an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. LAST_STOPPED_POINT - Resume reading from where the application last stopped reading.

nested_params.name: InputStartingPosition
nested_params.description: The starting position on the stream.

parameters.name: S3Configuration
parameters.description: Specify this parameter to discover a schema from data in an Amazon S3 object. The ARN of the S3 bucket that contains the data. The name of the object that contains the data.

nested_params.name: BucketARN
nested_params.description: The ARN of the S3 bucket that contains the data.

nested_params.name: FileKey
nested_params.description: The name of the object that contains the data.

parameters.name: InputProcessingConfiguration
parameters.description: The  InputProcessingConfiguration to use to preprocess the records before discovering the schema of the records. The  InputLambdaProcessor that is used to preprocess the records in the stream before being processed by your application code. The ARN of the Amazon Lambda function that operates on records in the stream.

nested_params.name: InputLambdaProcessor
nested_params.description: The  InputLambdaProcessor that is used to preprocess the records in the stream before being processed by your application code.

nested_params.name: ResourceARN
nested_params.description: The ARN of the Amazon Lambda function that operates on records in the stream.

nested_items.name: InputSchema
nested_items.description: The schema inferred from the streaming source. It identifies the format of the data in the streaming source and how each data element maps to corresponding columns in the in-application stream that you can create.

nested_items.name: RecordFormat
nested_items.description: Specifies the format of the records on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordFormatType
nested_items.description: The type of record format.

nested_items.name: MappingParameters
nested_items.description: When you configure application input at the time of creating or updating an application, provides additional mapping information specific to the record format (such as JSON, CSV, or record fields delimited by some delimiter) on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: JSONMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordRowPath
nested_items.description: The path to the top-level parent that contains the records.

nested_items.name: CSVMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses delimiters (for example, CSV).

nested_items.name: RecordRowDelimiter
nested_items.description: The row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, --n' is the typical row delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordColumnDelimiter
nested_items.description: The column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (',') is the typical column delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordEncoding
nested_items.description: Specifies the encoding of the records in the streaming source. For example, UTF-8.

nested_items.name: RecordColumns
nested_items.description: A list of RecordColumn objects.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the column that is created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: Mapping
nested_items.description: A reference to the data element in the streaming input or the reference data source.

nested_items.name: SqlType
nested_items.description: The type of column created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: ParsedInputRecords
nested_items.description: An array of elements, where each element corresponds to a row in a stream record (a stream record can have more than one row).
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProcessedInputRecords
nested_items.description: The stream data that was modified by the processor specified in the InputProcessingConfiguration parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RawInputRecords
nested_items.description: The raw stream data that was sampled to infer the schema.
(string) ---
